Package core

Class DB

java.lang.Object
core.DB
public class DB
extends java.lang.Object

Database class that handles all the SQlite data read and write operations.

It must be associated with a certain DB file location, and reads and writes the layers and shapes from the canvas.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    (package private) Canvas canvas  
    (package private) SQLite db  
    (package private) Layer layer  
    (package private) PApplet pApplet  
    (package private) java.lang.String path

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    DB​(PApplet pApplet, Canvas canvas)
    Creates a new DB and associates it with the main pApplet and the Canvas.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.lang.String getPath()  
    boolean hasData()
    Checks if the currently associated DB has any data in it.
    void init​(java.lang.String connectPath)
    Initializes the DB.
    void read()
    Reads all the data in the currently associated database and applies the data to the canvas class adding layers, shapes and their attributes (and the canvas color).

    Changes the file the DB is linked to and reinitializes the file, uless the new path is empty.
    void write()
    Writes all of the layers, shapes and their attributes (and the canvas color) to the currently associated DB file.

  • Constructor Details

    • DB

      public DB​(PApplet pApplet, Canvas canvas)
      Creates a new DB and associates it with the main pApplet and the Canvas.
      Parameters:
      pApplet - The handle of the pApplet
      canvas - The handle of the canvas

  • Method Details

    • init

      public void init​(java.lang.String connectPath)
      Initializes the DB. It creates a new file if a file with the given name doesn't exist and prepares it for data entry if is empty.
      Parameters:
      connectPath - The path to initialize the database with

    • getPath

      public java.lang.String getPath()
      Returns:
      The path the DB is currently associated with

    • setPath

      public void setPath​(java.lang.String newPath)
      Changes the file the DB is linked to and reinitializes the file, uless the new path is empty.
      Parameters:
      newPath - The new path to a file

    • read

      public void read()
      Reads all the data in the currently associated database and applies the data to the canvas class adding layers, shapes and their attributes (and the canvas color).

    • write

      public void write()
      Writes all of the layers, shapes and their attributes (and the canvas color) to the currently associated DB file. Warning: Overwrites any currently existing data in that file.

    • hasData

      public boolean hasData()
      Checks if the currently associated DB has any data in it.
      Returns:
      True if there is data in the currently associated file
